main event: On March 9, 1957, passengers aboard Pan American World Airways Flight 257 reported an encounter with a bright unidentified flying object while flying from New York to San Juan, Puerto Rico.
interesting points: The object was described as a fiery ball with a bluish-green tail,The pilot executed a steep climb to avoid a collision, resulting in several passenger injuries,Multiple witnesses, including other pilots, reported similar sightings in the area at the same time,The sighting lasted for several seconds and the object disappeared quickly,The incident received wide media attention after reports were made to the Civil Aeronautics Board.
location: 350 mi NE Jacksonville, Georgia, N.C., S.C.
witness description: Passengers and crew members on Flight 257.
